comments:
When I first moved to I20070313-1051 I could not synch or browse the eclipse.org CVS repositories because the following error kept being thrown.  I worked around this by changing my SSH2 directory in the new preference page.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.legacy.PreferenceForwarder.setValue(PreferenceForwarder.java:666)
at org.eclipse.jsch.internal.core.PreferenceInitializer.initializeDefaultPreferences(PreferenceInitializer.java:58)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.PreferenceServiceRegistryHelper.runInitializer(PreferenceServiceRegistryHelper.java:276)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.PreferenceServiceRegistryHelper.applyRuntimeDefaults(PreferenceServiceRegistryHelper.java:130)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.PreferencesService.applyRuntimeDefaults(PreferencesService.java:337)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.DefaultPreferences.applyRuntimeDefaults(DefaultPreferences.java:162)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.DefaultPreferences.loadDefaults(DefaultPreferences.java:231)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.DefaultPreferences.load(DefaultPreferences.java:227)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.EclipsePreferences.create(EclipsePreferences.java:307)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.EclipsePreferences.internalNode(EclipsePreferences.java:543)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.DefaultPreferences.node(DefaultPreferences.java:149)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.legacy.PreferenceForwarder.getDefaultPreferences(PreferenceForwarder.java:136)
at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.legacy.PreferenceForwarder.getString(PreferenceForwarder.java:642)
at org.eclipse.jsch.internal.core.JSchCorePlugin.loadKnownHosts(JSchCorePlugin.java:182)
at org.eclipse.jsch.internal.core.JSchProvider.createSession(JSchProvider.java:35)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.JSchSession.createSession(JSchSession.java:408)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.JSchSession.getSession(JSchSession.java:378)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.CVSSSH2ServerConnection.internalOpen(CVSSSH2ServerConnection.java:122)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.ssh2.CVSSSH2ServerConnection.open(CVSSSH2ServerConnection.java:107)
at org.eclipse.team.internal.ccvs.core.connection.Connection.open(Connection.java:132)

A potentially related problem I noticed is that in one of my runtime workspaces I get this error when trying to first open the SSH2 preference page.  If I go to another page, and then back to the SSH2 one, it does display, but has no values set.  Closing and reopening the preferences dialog caused the values to show up correctly.

java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.legacy.PreferenceForwarder.setValue(PreferenceForwarder.java:666)
	at org.eclipse.jsch.internal.core.PreferenceInitializer.initializeDefaultPreferences(PreferenceInitializer.java:58)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.PreferenceServiceRegistryHelper.runInitializer(PreferenceServiceRegistryHelper.java:276)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.PreferenceServiceRegistryHelper.applyRuntimeDefaults(PreferenceServiceRegistryHelper.java:130)
	at org.eclipse.core.internal.preferences.PreferencesService.applyRuntimeDefaults(PreferencesService.java:337)

This problem will be fixed by the fix at
  https://bugs.eclipse.org/bugs/show_bug.cgi?id=177288#c3

Not sure if it's really a duplicate of bug 177288 though? I've never seen these exceptions, just noticed the empty Preference page when starting on an old Workspace that had a non-standard SSH2 home directory set.

(In reply to comment #2)
> Not sure if it's really a duplicate of bug 177288 though? I've never seen these
> exceptions, just noticed the empty Preference page when starting on an old
> Workspace that had a non-standard SSH2 home directory set.

Really?  According to steps on bug 177288, I found similar exception on
error log, and could find the bug and has posted that patch.

Really. At least I _think_ I have checked the PDE Errorlog as I always do.
But I may be wrong, of course :-)

(In reply to comment #4)
> Really. At least I _think_ I have checked the PDE Errorlog as I always do.
> But I may be wrong, of course :-)

I'm sorry, but I'm not familiar with the term "PDE Errorlog".
Does it mean 
 Help > About Eclipse SDK > Configuration Details > View Error Log
?

Window > Show View > Other > PDE Runtime > Error Log.

Which is available only on eclipse-SDK (JDT + PDE installed) but shows the same information as Help > About > Configuration Details > View Error Log in a more user-friendly manner.

This works for me when migrating a 3.2.2 workspace to 3.3 so it looks like this was the same problem as bug 177288.

*** This bug has been marked as a duplicate of bug 177288 ***
